captions.text:
We're running this all
one more time, right?

With all the players and everything?
Okay, cool.

We are very pleased to be
joined by Imagine Dragons.

Gentlemen, thank
you for joining us.

I understand this is your
first time here in Korea.
How has Seoul been for you guys?

I love Korea. To come to a
country for the first time,

be playing with 120 local
musicians…in a stadium!

I didn't think you could
get more crazy and epic!

My name is Sebastien, and I am one
of the composers at Riot Games.

So the opening World
Ceremony, so it started with

working with Imagine Dragons
on the Warrior piece.

We met Christian, who is over
the music at League of Legends.

We sent them stuff, they sent stuff back to us.
We'd work like that.

It's a really close relationship,
really really close.

It was a month of, kind of starting to create
a song, you know, get the bare skeletons

together, and he said, well let me pull it in
with this huge, like 100-piece orchestra I have.
It was a really fun process.

We have been late on stage in front
of like 20 plus people in an arena,

literally, just due to the fact that
we were playing League of Legends.
Shhh. Don’t tell anyone that.

So we're hanging out back
here in Sangam Stadium, we've

taken over a conference room
and turned it into a PC Bang.

And we're back with Imagine
Dragons, it's 1 to 1

so far, but somebody's going
to go home sad today.
You got it! We're good, we're good.

One of our music producers
was like "Hey, would

you like to play a game
with Imagine Dragons?"

And I'm like "Would I like to play
a game with Imagine Dragons????"

I got matched up with
Dan, or Platz, in the

bottom lane, and he plays
a pretty good Caitlyn.

We were pretty aggressive all game long,
they were really cool. They're so

"normal gamer dudes" who like to game
just like us, and that was really fun.

You guys, there might be a dragon.
I'm hearing there might be a dragon.

They had to start doing
their vocal exercises

during the game, which
was really cool.

These guys are literally getting as
much time in on League before they

have to go get themselves ready for
tomorrow, it's going to be huge.

There's all these people that have to take
the stage during like a 15-minute span.

We have all the traditional drummers that
are here, plus Imagine Dragons, plus

players, plus a flag bearers for the players,
plus the announcer guy from Korea OGN...
Please welcome Imagine Dragons!!!!
That was crazy! Lotta energy.

The games were really exciting. I
mean the first two went pretty quick.

And then when Royal Club took
Game 3, that was huge, you know.

The one that really hurt
my soul the most, was

they had the kill, and
then Janna shields it.
Kha'zix yeah

It was the Khaz yeah. That
one, that was brutal.
It's happened to all of us, right?
We've all been there.

To play a show in a place
you've never been, ever, and to

get that kind of response…it's
really hard to describe it.

But it almost feels like we don't deserve it?
Who made this mistake

that we're playing for this crowd?
But it's a really great feeling.
We love you, thank you for having us!

title: Behind the Scenes: Imagine Dragons at Worlds

Love and Peace.﻿
